newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - April 10.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - April 10.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Treasurer Peter Costello released the long-awaited Wallis report on Financial System reform, announcing the end of the "Six Pillars" policy which prevented mergers involving the big four banks and the big two insurance groups. But he said the big four banks themselves could not merge until there was more competition. He also ended the ban on foreign ownership of the big banks, but warned that foreigners could not buy too much of the sector.

Village Roadshow Ltd said on Wednesday it had lifted its takeover offer for radio group Austereo to A$2.55 a share from A$2.35 a share and extended the offer period to May 9. The company said that the independent directors of Austereo now recommended Austereo shareholders accept the revised bid in the absence of any higher offer.

The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd will quit exploration work in up to a dozen countries and close mineral exploration offices in North America to cut costs and accelerate new projects, The Australian Financial Review newspaper said on Thursday.
St Lukes Group said on Thursday in Wellington that Westfield Holdings had been appointed to manage and develop its NZ$700 million New Zealand shopping centre portfolio.

Computer group Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd said on Wednesday it would go ahead with a planned listing on the U.S. NASDAQ main board. Formulab said it had started the registration process and expected to achieve compliance listing on the NASDAQ SmallCap market within six weeks.
